text: Doesn't the fault lie with PyPI and package authors mostly?
If an author uploads crap source tarball (eg: missing files, no setup.py) to PyPI, then both pip and easy_install will fail.
Other than cosmetic differences, why do Python people (like in the above tweet) seem to strongly favor pip over easy_install?

childList.text: fault lie with PyPI and package authors mostly

text: (Let's assume that we're talking about easy_install from the Distribute package, that is maintained by the community)
